briefdescription.para: Set neutral h decays computed by FeynHiggs.

detaileddescription.para: These functions are given a different capability to regular decay functions, to allow other module functions to specifically depend on the SM values for reference, even when scanning another model. Reference SM Higgs decays from LHCHiggsXSWG: most SM-like Higgs

briefdescription.para: Reference SM Higgs decays from LHCHiggsXSWG: least SM-like Higgs.
Reference SM Higgs decays from LHCHiggsXSWG: A0.
Reference SM Higgs decays from FeynHiggs: h0_1.
Reference SM Higgs decays from FeynHiggs: h0_2.
Reference SM Higgs decays from FeynHiggs: A0.
Construct a decay table entry for a particle from the entry for its antiparticle.

detaileddescription.para: Construct a decay table entry for a particle, from the entry for its antiparticle.
FeynHiggs MSSM decays: t Reference for total width: 2017 PDG

briefdescription.para: MSSM decays: stau_1 (Uses SUSY-HIT results or dedicated DecayBit calculation for small mass splittings)

detaileddescription.para: SUSY-HIT MSSM decays: snu_taul Note that SUSY-HIT calls ~nu_tau_L "snutau1" even though it has no RH (~)nus.

briefdescription.para: MSSM decays: chargino_plus_1 (Uses SUSY-HIT results or dedicated DecayBit calculation for small mass splittings)

detaileddescription.para: MSSM decays: chargino decays for small charginoneutralino mass splitting. Using results from hep-ph/9607421.
MSSM decays: stau decays for small stauneutralino mass splitting. Using results from T. Jittoh, J. Sato, T. Shimomura, M. Yamanaka, Phys. Rev. D73 (2006), hep-ph/0512197

briefdescription.para: Add the decay of Higgs to singlets for the ScalarSingletDM models.
Add the decay of Higgs to vectors for the VectorSingletDM models (see arXiv:1512.06458v4)
Add the decay of Higgs to Majorana fermions for the MajoranaSingletDM models (see arXiv:1512.06458v4)
Add the decay of Higgs to Dirac fermions for the DiracSingletDM models (see arXiv:1512.06458v4)
Collect all the DecayTable entries into an actual DecayTable.

inbodydescription.para: Spit out the full decay table as SLHA1 and SLHA2 files.

Check all particles for negative decay width
Spit out the full decay table as an SLHA file.

detaileddescription.para: Read an SLHA2 file in and use it to create a GAMBIT DecayTable. Note that creating a DecayTable from an SLHA1 file is not possible at present.

briefdescription.para: Convert the DecayTable to a format where we can print each individual channel's BF.

inbodydescription.para: Otherwise just print the specific, named channels

briefdescription.para: Get MSSM mass eigenstate pseudonyms for the gauge eigenstates.

detaileddescription.para: SLHA1 mixing check flag This gets set non-zero if first or second generation left-right mixing exceeds the specified tolerance (which means that SLHA1 is an invalid format for this model point). 1 = u, 2 = d, 3 = c, 4 = s, 5 = e, 6 = mu

inbodydescription.para: Branching fraction for Higgs into pair of lightest neutralinos

simplesect.para: Assumes decoupling limit for Higgs mixing angle \[ \alpha = \beta - \frac12 \pi \]
Only includes neutralinos, charginos and SM-like width in total width

inbodydescription.para:
Branching fraction for Higgs into scalar singlet DM
BF
$\textrm{BR}(h\to S S)$

Branching fraction for Higgs into vector singlet DM
BF
$\textrm{BR}(h\to V V)$

Branching fraction for Higgs into Majorana singlet DM
BF
$\textrm{BR}(h\to X X)$

Branching fraction for Higgs into Dirac singlet DM
BF
$\textrm{BR}(h\to F F)$
Log-likelihood for Higgs invisible branching ratio
We use log-likelihoods extracted from e.g., CMS-PAS-HIG-17-023

There are scripts python./DecayBit/data/convolve_with_theory.py<file><frac_error><min><max> for convolving a data file with a fractional theory error, and python./DecayBit/data/profile_theory.py<file><frac_error><min><max> for profiling a fractional theory error.

There are a few data files, e.g., ./DecayBit/data/arXiv_1306.2941_Figure_8.dat ./DecayBit/data/CMS-PAS-HIG-17-023_Figure_7-b.dat ./DecayBit/data/CMS-PAS-HIG-17-023_Figure_7-b_10_convolved.dat ./DecayBit/data/CMS-PAS-HIG-17-023_Figure_7-b_10_profiled.dat The first one is the default. The third and fourth ones include a 10% theory uncertainty in the branching fraction by convolving it and profiling it, respectively. The data file is specified in the YAML by the BR_h_inv_chi2_data_file option. The path is relative to the GAMBIT directory, GAMBIT_DIR.

simplesect.para: This typically assumes that the Higgs is otherwise SM-like, i.e., no changes to production cross sections or any other decays.

parameterdescription.para: Log-likelihood for Higgs invisible branching ratio

inbodydescription.para: Log-likelihood from LEP measurements of $Z$-boson invisible width

simplesect.para: This is valid for SM, RHN models and for MSSM-like models with Z-boson invisible decays to neutralinos and neutrinos

inbodydescription.para: Calculate width of $Z$ decays to neutrinos (with RHN correction if present), $\Gamma(Z\to\nu\nu)$ at two-loop in GeV

simplesect.para: This uses input $\alpha(M_Z)$ - does not include input light-quark thresholds.

inbodydescription.para: Calculate width of $Z$ decays to the lightest neutralinos, $\Gamma(Z\to\chi^0_1\chi^0_1)$ in GeV
